official-title.#text:
Establishing an academic competition in the field of robotics among students in Congressional
			 districts.

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: This resolution may be cited as the

STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) fields and knowledge have been integral to
			 the development of civilization over the centuries.

The competitiveness of the United States in the field of robotics in particular is vital to a
			 strong, thriving economy in a world of continuous and rapid technological
			 advancements and needs.

Robots serve myriad functions that humans cannot, including reducing exposure to toxins and
			 increasing accuracy and speed on assembly lines, thereby reducing risk to
			 members of the military and first responders, among others.

Robotics technology research and development should be a priority of the United States, especially
			 in
			 encouraging students of all ages to pursue careers in robotics and other
			 STEM fields.

The robotics industry is positioned to fuel a broad array of next-generation products and
			 applications in fields as diverse as manufacturing, health-care, national
			 defense and security, agriculture, and transportation.

The global economy demands that the United States continue to lead the world in innovation,
			 creativity, and robotics-related advancements.

Bringing together Members of Congress and their younger constituents to participate in activities
			 that will result in a deeper appreciation for robotics will foster
			 enthusiasm for education in the sciences.

The support which students will gain through Congressional recognition of their work on
			 robotics-related projects will encourage them to pursue career paths in
			 robotics, continuing the leadership of the United States in robotics
			 technology development.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to institute a new and worthwhile competition to
			 encourage students to participate in robotics studies and research.

text.#text:
It would be appropriate to initially challenge students to develop robots that serve certain
			 functions in everyday life.

There is hereby established an academic competition in the field of robotics which shall be held
			 each year among students in each Congressional district.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, except that
			 the regulations shall permit the office of a Member to seek guidance from
			 outside experts in the fields of science, technology, engineering, and
			 mathematics—for the purposes of establishing criteria for the selection of
			 competition judges and for the
			 judgment of competition submissions.

text.#text:
The competition under this resolution shall be carried out in accordance with such regulations as
			 may be prescribed by the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 703 IH: Establishing an academic competition in the field of robotics among students in Congressional districts.
